meanings.definition: The central axis or shaft of a feather.
meanings.sent1: The bird preened its feathers, ensuring the strength of the rachises.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the anatomy of the rachises in different bird species.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer joked that the rachises of the feather could be a stylish accessory.
meanings.sent4: The rachises of the feather stood tall and proud, like a flagpole in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The rachises of the feather were like the backbone, providing structure and support.

meanings.definition: The central axis of a compound leaf.
meanings.sent1: The botanist examined the rachises of the compound leaf under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully trimmed the rachises to promote healthy leaf growth.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the rachises of the compound leaf as a tiny bridge to reach the other side.
meanings.sent4: The rachises of the compound leaf intertwined like a maze in the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The rachises of the compound leaf resembled the main road, guiding nutrients to each leaflet.

meanings.definition: The central axis of a pinnate leaf.
meanings.sent1: The biology student learned about the structure and function of the rachises in pinnate leaves.
meanings.sent2: The wind gently rustled the rachises of the pinnate leaf, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The artist used the rachises of the pinnate leaf as inspiration for a delicate painting.
meanings.sent4: The rachises of the pinnate leaf were like the spine of a book, holding the leaflets together.
meanings.sent5: The rachises of the pinnate leaf were like the conductor, orchestrating the growth of the leaflets.
